column5: Well, we had been counting down the days to the Musky Opener, and it finally arrived. We decided that we would drive down to Mitchell's Bay Friday night and get a camp site.  We stayed at Bass Haven, nice and close to the action, everything you could ever want for fishing. We got the boat out Friday night, didn't get much of anything, a couple OOS Bass, some small perch, a small pike.  Saturday morning we were on the water by 6:45 am, we had lines wet by 7:00am.  Not much happening, water was a little rough.  We tried shallow to start with, but then headed out a little deeper, eventually the water calmed down enough to put a planer board out, and within minutes we had the first musky of the season, a healthy 38    We ended up getting about 4 more OOS bass, some pretty big ones to, I won't post the links, but if your computer savvy I'm sure you can figure out how to see the pics...  My brother and his 3 year old came out in the afternoon, Sawyer's first time on a boat... he was pumped... Brave little pirate he was...  I tried and tried of find him the perch, but no luck, I put him on a couple of rock bass, and he got a nice OOS Small mouth when his attention waned and he put his pole down for about 30 seconds...   We took them back to shore, had a quick nap, and we were out again.  We nailed this 42 around 8:45    That was the end of the musky for the weekend... The winds really picked up and with the thunderstorms Saturday night it was hard to find much of anything.
